meanings.definition: To transfer goods from one ship to another.
meanings.sent1: The sailors will tranships the cargo to the larger vessel.
meanings.sent2: The workers tranships the supplies onto the new ship.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cargo cross the sea? To get transhipped to another boat!
meanings.sent4: The goods tranships like a game of hot potato from ship to ship.
meanings.sent5: The process of transhipping is like a dance of moving items across the water.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring goods from one ship to another.
meanings.sent1: The tranships of the cargo went smoothly between the two vessels.
meanings.sent2: The tranships of the supplies took place at the dock.
meanings.sent3: The tranships of the goods was like a well-choreographed performance on the sea.
meanings.sent4: The tranships of the items resembled a relay race on the water.
meanings.sent5: The tranships of the cargo created a bustling scene at the port.
